quest.name: Slave to the Code
journal: Jacke is determined to track down the remnants of the Jolly Merchants.

Putting himself in his marks' shoes, Jacke hazards a guess as to where the last of the Jolly Merchants will likely be hiding. Head out to the Flock in western La Noscea and search for signs of the remaining slavers.

After discovering a family of villagers tied up amongst the dodo nests, you are confronted by the final gang of slavers. One hectic and feather-filled battle later, the pirates are defeated and the Jolly Merchants no more. See to the well-being of the captive smallfolk.

As you are tending to the traumatized villagers, you are approached by a trio of Yellowjackets led by one Captain Milala. The Yellowjacket captain appears fanatically opposed to anything with the slightest connection to piracy, and challenges the Rogues' Guild to a contest to justify its very existence. Return to the guild and discuss this development with Jacke.

You return to the Dutiful Sisters to find Jacke still chafing over Captain Milala's presumptuous challenge. Bound by the code, however, the guildmaster fully intends to reclaim the stolen treasures even if it means dancing to the Yellowjacket's tune. Master the Mug ability and continue sharpening your skills that you might ensure victory for the guild.

※The next rogue quest will be available from Jacke upon reaching level 20.
objectives: Search the Flock for signs of the Jolly Merchants.
Speak with Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Those last few Jolly Merchant bastards must be camped out somewhere in western La Noscea. Now, if I was a black-blooded, gil-grubbin' slaver, where would I be hidin'...?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: There's naught to the west but the Sahagin pools; even those bollocks-for-brains pirates know better'n to trespass on fishback territory.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' they won't want to chance runnin' into patrols near Aleport, so that just leaves us east. ...The Flock? Aye, they'll likely be nestled down in the ruins out there amongst the dodos.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That's where we'll try to pick up their trail. You head on over an' snilch the place while I send word to the Sisters an' the Maelstrom.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Head on over to the Flock an' see if ye can't spy our missin' slavers. I'll be along once I've passed on word to the Maelstrom an' our fellow coves.

dialogue.name: POORLADY00145
dialogue.text: Thank you for freeing us! We've been tied up here since those awful pirates snatched us from our beds.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Those are some interestin'-lookin' dodos ye've got there, Forename. ...No sign o' the Merchants, though, eh?

dialogue.name: POORLADY00145
dialogue.text: Their leader mentioned heading over to Aleport. He said something about there being no signal, and that was a signal that something was wrong.

dialogue.name: POORLADY00145
dialogue.text: They just left us hobbled here like lambs for the market; one of them japed about keeping the meat unsullied in case there was trouble... Pray let us flee this place before they return!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00145
dialogue.text: (-???-)An' who are you to just sidle in an' set loose our 'ard-won prizes? Hm?

dialogue.name: PIRATE00145
dialogue.text: 'Twas the damndest thing. We'd 'alf a crew lodgin' in Aleport, an' not a one of 'em survived the night. Done in by a couple o' sneaky curs what favored the shortblades, they say.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00145
dialogue.text: ...I'm supposin' that was you two. Seems ye've a bone to pick with our choice o' “trade.”

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, I can't say as I've much use for slavers...'cept as a place to bury me knives. Oh, an' I wouldn't bother yerself with waitin' on yer ship to come back neither. The Jolly Merchants are done for.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00145
dialogue.text: Hee hee hee! Ye might have the right of it, lad!

dialogue.name: PIRATE00145
dialogue.text: But then ye wouldn't know the kind o' coin three 'ealthy slaves like them ones'll bring us. I'll 'ave a new ship an' a new crew afore a single moon 'as passed.

dialogue.name: PIRATE00145
dialogue.text: Ye 'ear that, chattel? Yer each worth a shinin' bloody fortune! An' ye've me to thank for 'elpin' ye learn yer true worth!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ignore this bleatin' sod. In fact, why don't ye step back a ways?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: These coves are about to learn the consequences o' breakin' the code, an' the discussion is like to get messy.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Did ye not think we'd come for ye? Ye can try to stifle yer victims' screams in the darkmans, but the shadows are always listenin'!

dialogue.name: POORLADY00145
dialogue.text: Thank you. I shudder to think what horrid fate awaited us had you not helped us to escape...

dialogue.name: POORBOY00145
dialogue.text: I knew someone would come! You're just like the heroes in the stories!

dialogue.name: POORBOY00145
dialogue.text: They always arrive at the perfect time and triumph over the villains! Do you think I could be a hero like you? I know I could be brave and strong, too. I just know it!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I... Ye don't want to be like me, lad.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Listen, now. Me an' those coves there, we're the ones what the scary folk are afraid of. An' that's 'cause we keep the rules for the world they live in.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: We don't much care if ye shirk yer chores, or get into fights...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: But if ye ever break the code an' betray yer mates, then that's when we'll come after ye─no matter how far ye run or how well ye hide!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Live yer life like the hero ye want to be, though, an' ye'll never need worry about that.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye? You two can stubble it, an' all!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: (-Yellowjacket Soldier-)I assume you are the citizens who were abducted by the Jolly Merchants?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: I am Captain Milala of the Yellowjackets. Maelstrom Command has entrusted me with conducting you to safety.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: It's all right, lad, these folk'll take care of ye. ...Go on, ye'd best not get left behind.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Was there aught else, Captain? Word on a new job?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: A job? From me? ...For you?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: How patently absurd! Why, I'd rather hire a sewer rat to mind my larder!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Was it during one of your “jobs” that you turned Aleport into a slaughterhouse? What dark age is this that we must employ assassins to enforce the law!?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: It is this continued dalliance with underworld miscreants such as you that prevents Limsa Lominsa from ever fully expunging the stain of piratical infection!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Look at these weapons you bear! A civilized person uses such implements to carve meat or peel fruit, and leaves them at table where they belong!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Do you perhaps clench them 'twixt your teeth as you swing over rails like the pirates you hunt? Our fair city has no place for those who refuse to abandon the brutish ways of the past...

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: The only champions of justice this nation requires are the valiant and forthright soldiers of the Yellowjackets!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Jacke... What the bloody hells does this cull want with us?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I've not the foggiest idea, love. Just smile an' nod.

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: I've not come here to be patronized─I've come to put a decisive end to piracy in all its forms! Consider this visit a gauntlet thrown at the collective feet of the Rogues' Guild!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Heed well my words. Just before dawn this very morn, a Maelstrom vessel stocked with provisions was boarded and looted by pirates.

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Much of the cargo was stolen, and that is vexing indeed. But it is the theft of three items in particular─three unique treasures of nigh-incalculable worth─that most distresses my martial colleagues.

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: As for the brigands, they made well their escape, disappearing into the dawn's mist along with their precious plunder...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: A rum tale. What's it to do with us?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: I challenge you! A contest to reclaim these stolen treasures!

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Should my Yellowjackets and I succeed in retrieving the greater share, I shall formally propose the abolition of the Rogues' Guild. Upon review of our achievements, the Admiral will surely concede that your unscrupulous institution has outlived its usefulness.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, blow it out yer wattle. I've better ways to spend me time.

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Oh, do you now? This incident constitutes a theft against the nation of Limsa Lominsa. Does that not violate your beloved code?

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: If I'm not mistaken, you've no choice but to rise to the occasion. ...Unless of course, you mean to slink back into your hole and abandon the fundamental precepts of your “duty”?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All right, all right, ye screechin' shrew─ye've made yer bloody point. An' ye'll be sorry that ye did, I promise ye that.

dialogue.name: MILALA
dialogue.text: Your paltry promises amount to naught in the face of my conviction. I shall not rest until Limsa Lominsa is free of every last buccaneer, scoundrel, and shadow-dwelling ne'er-do-well!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: ...What now, Jacke?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: For right now? We head back to the Sisters.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: For a wee lass, that Milala's got some bollocks. An' it seems she's well done with aught what whiffs o' pirate stock.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Hmph. I don't take kindly to culls pullin' me strings, but the shrew is right─the code's been broken an' we've a job to do.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: From the sounds of it, though, them coves knew what they were about when they cloyed them treasures. I'll need ye at yer best.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: It's time ye learned the art o' muggin'! Rough up a cull in just the right way, an' he'll give up more than what ye'd get if ye just plain knocked him on his arse.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Me an' the lads'll be busy whiddlin' the story on them bitten baubles, so yer free to head out an' sharpen yer skill─might even be as ye'll pocket some extra blunt while yer at it, eh?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the Jolly Merchants!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Stow yer whids an' draw yer steel!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Always more of 'em...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: These birds move slow, but they've a nasty peck!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
Keep yer distance an' skewer 'em from afar!
Aye, throw yer bloody daggers at 'em, lasslad!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
Ugh, more dodos!?
Thought they was slavers, not bleedin' farmers!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
Stay calm now, lasslad!
Take 'em one at a time!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
An' still they come...
Bene! Saves us the searchin'!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
Get out o' here, Forename.
Take the captives an' go...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
No scraps for latecomers!
The lasscolt an' me had a hunger!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text:
You coves took yer sweet time!
Let's mop this up already!

dialogue.name: BOSS
dialogue.text:
I like me slaves with a bit o' fight!
Ye'll fetch a grand price on the block!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text:
This's a fine pile o' quarrons!
There's naught for us to do...

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Yer not the only ones with reinforcements!

dialogue.name: PERIMU
dialogue.text: Underfoot is here to get underfoot!

dialogue.name: PERIMU
dialogue.text: ...Or, at least I would if any bugger was left standin'.
